Name: Sunshade of King Tutankhamun
Description: This sunshade is a testimony to the ancient Egyptian craftsman's creativity and ingenuity. Made of four poles of gilded wood and shaped like a lotus flower, it opens and closes via copper devices and a system of wiring or linen strings that stretch its hanging parts by opening tiny hinges. The framework would have had a textile cover when in use. The four poles were fixed in holes drilled in the wooden base for stability.
